text: [Music]
hi guys I'm Laura Vitale on this episode
of Laura in the kitchen I'm gonna show
you my signature drink for New Year's
now every New Year's Eve I always go to
a certain place with my friends to
celebrate and I always get the specific
drink and I figured just like anything
else I love from a restaurant I have to
recreate it at home so this is my
version of a delicious citrus limoncello
martini it's quick and simple to do it
requires just a few ingredients I'll
give you some alternatives if you don't
want to use alcohol but before we get
started let's go over the ingredients
you're gonna need some freshly squeezed
orange juice you're gonna need some
lemoncello which is a lemon liqueur
you're gonna need a little bit of vodka
and some fresh lemon juice now if you
don't want to make this alcoholic you
can just substitute the lemoncello
with some frozen lemon concentrate but
you can just thaw and just forget about
the vodka so it would be just a little
bit of fresh orange juice some lemon
concentrate and a shot of lemon juice
that's it and that could be a great
non-alcoholic alternative now I'm gonna
do this in my little shaker I'm gonna
put in some ice of course I like my
martini shaken not stirred and in here
we're gonna put all my ingredients now
it really depends on how strong you'd
like to drink if you like yours really
really strong then you could just put a
bit more a bit more of the vodka and a
bit more of the lemon cello I like to do
four parts orange juice to two parts
limoncello one part one part vodka and
just a splash of lemon juice but the
ingredients will be listed on lowering
the kitchen comm so go ahead and check
that out so you put all of your
ingredients in the shaker seal it and
then just shake
nice and cold ready that's good good
enough just pour this into little
martini glass whoops look at that color
fabulous let put my lips around this and
welcome to New Year with open arms
amazing absolutely amazing if you love
stitches and you love yourself a good
martini you have just got to give this a
try it's refreshing it's so it's not
overly sweet but it's just sweet enough
that's it I hope you've enjoyed spending
time with me thank you so much for you
know staying on this journey with me
2011 was fantastic and I just can't wait
to share 2012 with you so having said
that I'll see you next year bye bye
[Music]
you
